sentences.sContent: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.sCn: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.sContent: Their lack of qualifications condemned them to a lifetime of boring, usually poorly-paid work.
sentences.sCn: 他们资历的缺乏迫使他们要一辈子做单调乏味且通常报酬很低的工作。

words.tran: 该受责备的，应受谴责的；该罚的；应定罪的，该定罪的
谴责；定罪；非难的理由；征用

remMethod.val: con(表加强) ＋ dem(民众) ＋ n → 受民众强烈谴责 → 谴责

trans.tranOther: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong
